str2: A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: To also, I too, but I. From kai and ego; so also the dative case kamoi, and accusative case kame and I, me.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Spiritual. From pneuma; non-carnal, i.e. ethereal, or a spirit, or supernatural, regenerate, religious.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Fleshly, consisting of flesh, carnal. From sarx; similar to flesh, i.e. soft.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
From an obsolete particle ne- and epos; not speaking, i.e. An infant; figuratively, a simple-minded person, an immature Christian.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
